content: Is the Index of United States Implementation Guides generated the IG publisher, or was that manually set up? I'd like to do something similar to list all of the Implementation Guides for my organization.
Anyone know the answer to the above?
by the publication tooling (a special mode of the IG publisher that maintains published websites)
@Grahame Grieve - is there any documentation on how one would use this special mode of the IG publisher?
what special mode are you asking about?

@John Moehrke - I was previously asking about the Index of United States Implementation Guides page - Grahame mentioned that it was generated "by the publication tooling (a special mode of the IG publisher that maintains published websites)"
ah, he was refering to the process HL7 goes thru to take an approved IG to publication on the hl7.org site. So it is not a mode of the publisher, it is a method of using the publisher.

@Grahame Grieve @John Moehrke - is there a way to use that same tooling to host IGs on a third-party domain? To clarify, I know how to use the IG publisher.jar, but I'm specifically interested in a dynamic index page for multiple IGs.
Yes, Please take that discussion to the #IG creation stream - Instructions are available https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=104580055
